intro: Lastrea pallens, commonly known as the silver leaf tree, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, pale green leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in racemes, and it is often grown as an ornamental due to its unique appearance. Its leaves are succulent and can store water, making it adapted to arid environments. The species is also valued for its ability to fix nitrogen, contributing to soil fertility.
